details: Sony WH-1000XM4 has more effective ANC than WH-1000XM5 according to rtings.com
Sony WH-1000XM5 has better ANC than WH-1000XM4 according to soundguys.com

Sony WH-1000XM5 is highly praised for its comfort, with users mentioning the excellent padding and overall fit. Bose Noise Canceling 700 also offers a comfortable experience, with a focus on plush ear cushions. Sennheiser Momentum 4 provides a comfortable fit, but some users find the clamping force slightly higher. Sennheiser Momentum 3 offers good comfort, but some users mention that the ear cups are a bit small. Bose QuietComfort QC 45 is comfortable, but some users find the padding less plush compared to other models.
User mentioned that the Sony WH-1000XM5 fit amazingly and caused no discomfort
User had an issue with the ear cups being a little small on the Bowers P7
Comfort is very important, clamping force still an issue with Bowers P8
Sony WH-1000XM5 and Sennheiser Momentum 4 Wireless can be connected by wire, but no specific details on listening response provided
Sony WH-1000XM5 is leading in terms of wireless connectivity and user-friendliness
Sony WH-1000XM5 is suggested to have a high-end version like Bowers & Wilkins PX8
Sony WH-1000XM5 excels in call quality, Sony WH-1000XM4 follows closely behind, Bose ranks third in call performance.
The microphone on the Sony WH-1000XM5 is far superior to the microphone on the Bose QC Ultra, blocking out background noises better.
Specific details on the microphone performance of the unknown competitor are not provided in the data.
Sony WH-1000XM5 and Sony WH-1000XM4 both support sbc, aac, and ldac codecs, giving them an advantage over competitors like Bose 700, which only support sbc and aac.
AirPods Max also support sbc, aac, and alac codecs, but do not support ldac, which is a significant advantage for Sony headphones in terms of audio quality.
Sennheiser Momentum 3 supports sbc, aac, and aptx codecs, but lacks ldac support, putting it behind Sony headphones in terms of codec compatibility.
Sony WH-1000XM5 requires custom tuning on the Sony Headphones app and the Wavelet app autoeq to sound really good.
Bose headphones are better on the subway and on the plane.
Sennheiser offers the longest battery life at 62 hours, Sony WH-1000XM5 provides 30 hours, and Bose has the shortest battery life at 20 hours.
HD 800S has no bass shelf, providing a speaker-like sound without a subwoofer
Sony WH-1000XM4 has similar pricing to Sony WH-1000XM5
